name: Mount Kilimanjaro
short_description: Africa's highest peak at 5,895m. A UNESCO World Heritage Site and the world's tallest free-standing mountain, attracting trekkers from around the globe.

name: Chagga Village Cultural Tour
short_description: Explore the rich heritage of the Chagga people on the slopes of Kilimanjaro — traditional villages, coffee farms, underground tunnels, and authentic local cuisine.

name: Serengeti National Park
short_description: Home to the legendary Great Migration and Africa's highest density of predators. Over 1.5 million wildebeest cross these endless plains annually.
best_time_to_visit: June–October for river crossings; January–March for calving

name: Ngorongoro Crater
short_description: The world's largest intact volcanic caldera hosting 25,000 animals including Africa's densest lion population and endangered black rhinos.
best_time_to_visit: Year-round; June–September for dry season game drives

name: Tarangire National Park
short_description: Famous for spectacular elephant concentrations and ancient baobab trees. The Tarangire River draws thousands of animals in the dry season.

name: Lake Manyara National Park
short_description: A compact park famed for tree-climbing lions, vast flamingo flocks on its alkaline lake, and diverse habitats from Rift Valley forest to open floodplains.

name: Mount Meru
short_description: Tanzania's second-highest peak at 4,566m with a dramatic volcanic crater. An excellent Kilimanjaro acclimatisation route with exceptional wildlife on the approach.

name: Stone Town Zanzibar
short_description: A UNESCO World Heritage Site — a maze of narrow streets, carved wooden doors, and centuries of Swahili, Arab, and colonial history on Zanzibar island.

name: Nungwi Beach
short_description: Zanzibar's premier beach destination — brilliant white sand, turquoise waters, traditional dhow building, and excellent water sports at the island's northern tip.

name: Prison Island (Changuu Island)
short_description: A historic island housing Aldabra giant tortoises over 100 years old, surrounded by colourful coral reefs perfect for snorkelling — 30 minutes by boat from Stone Town.

name: Zanzibar Spice Farm Tour
short_description: Explore Zanzibar's legendary spice farms — see, smell, and taste cloves, nutmeg, cinnamon and vanilla on the island that shaped the global spice trade.
best_time_to_visit: Year-round, harvest seasons offer more activity

name: Jozani Chwaka Bay National Park
short_description: Home to the endemic Zanzibar red colobus monkey — found nowhere else on Earth — in Zanzibar's only national park with ancient forests and mangrove boardwalks.
best_time_to_visit: Year-round; early morning for best primate sightings
